meanings.sent1: I reprinted the document for you.
meanings.sent2: She reprinted the article to fix the errors.
meanings.sent3: The printer reprinted the page upside down by mistake.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's words were so important that they were reprinted in every student's mind.
meanings.sent5: The memory was so vivid that it felt like it had been reprinted in my mind.

meanings.sent1: He reprinted the email for reference.
meanings.sent2: They reprinted the brochure with updated information.
meanings.sent3: The cat accidentally reprinted its paw on the wet paint.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed in the room, as if it had been reprinted by the walls.
meanings.sent5: The melody was so beautiful that it seemed to be reprinted in the air around us.

meanings.definition: A new printing of a book or other printed material.
meanings.sent1: The bookstore received a shipment of reprints of the classic novel.
meanings.sent2: The library added the reprinted edition of the magazine to its collection.
meanings.sent3: The reprinted comic book cover had a misprint that made it collectible.
meanings.sent4: The reprinted map led them on a journey through the past.
meanings.sent5: The reprinted photograph brought back memories of a bygone era.
